title: Making Web3 Visible
description: How can we help end-users to truly understand the impact of the "Web3 Revolution"?

f6_assessments.q0:

this proposal will need more details.

I neither Agree or Disagree.

f6_assessments.q0:
Educating users about Web3 does not align with the Cardano mission. This challenge could be modified into a marketing/education campaign as a means to drive Cardano adoption.
I disagree this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
The challenge brief is not complete however the community could handle a challenge like this if framed correctly. The community needs to figure out how much we are willing to pay in recruitment costs to attract each new user regardless of challenge. A media education campaign challenge using that number as a guideline would likely be very cost effective compared to other challenges.
I agree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success criteria are relevant to the challenge question however the question and success criteria should be changed to align with a Cardano mission statement.
The key metrics are not measurable and should be changed.
I  disagree that the success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: Web3 is very likely to have an impact that very few people are aware of and as such I feel this is a valid challenge. I sense that developers are those that are most aware of what Web3 will actually mean to end users and as such promoting discussion and education in a challenge will have a trickle down effect to less technical users (such as myself).
f6_assessments.q1: Certainly the developers that make up a good portion of the Catalyst community will have the capacity to address the challenge. Those that may be unaware of what web3 entails will be motivated to learn exactly what web3 could mean to all. In this respect it makes sense to engage the community to realise the potential of web 3 constructs and start the creative juices flowing.
f6_assessments.q2: This challenge proposal may be ahead of its time although I do not see that as being a reason to not follow through with web 3 research and education for the Catalyst community. The metrics set out seem like a good starting point and I note the author requesting collaboration to flesh out further details. It may become an important challenge to the Catalyst community in the future.

importance: Unlike the move to "Web2" web-based apps that were easily visible to end users, the transition to Web3 is mostly happening "under the hood".
success: It was easy for users to see how web-based applications were different from static web sites. Let's make it that obvious to understand Web3.
